page.title: 10Llanrhychwyn
page.content: Housing in the area is very varied. In the sparsely populated land to the west are scattered houses. Some are homes in permanent use, some holiday homes, some working farms. They are mostly stone built, some with recent additions. As this area is in the Snowdonia National Park, strict regulations cover alterations to property. There is no mains water. Supplies come from wells, springs and streams, and rain is collected in tanks. There is one telephone box and one post box. Children are taken to schools in Trefriw (infant and junior) and in Llanrwst (senior) by taxi. Milk is delivered three times a week and refuse is collected fortnightly. There is a daily postal service. The roads are single track with passing places, of indifferent quality. Heavy snow creates many difficulties.
